main event: Multiple sightings of an unidentified object in the sky over Columbus, Ohio in 1949, observed by airport traffic employees, control tower operators, and university students.
interesting points: Witnesses observed a smoke trail first, and later, a bright light in the sky, with changes in color from white to yellowish-red.
The sighting involved multiple accounts of unusual airborne phenomena, including apparent vapor or smoke trails and a stationary bright light at high altitude.
Attempts were made to identify the object, including contacting other air traffic control towers and pilots, but no conclusive explanation was obtained.
The altitude of the observed object was estimated to be between 30,000 to 60,000 feet, and the direction of flight was described as westerly and later northerly.
The sightings were complemented by weather information, including details about scattered clouds and visibility, adding context to the atmospheric conditions during the events.
sighted object: unidentified object emitting smoke trails and changing in luminosity
witnesses: Multiple observers, including airport traffic employees, control tower operators, and a university student
